intro: Lomariopsis pteridiformis, commonly known as the fern-like liverwort, is a small, terrestrial liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like appearance, with intricate leaf structures that resemble those of true ferns. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It has a thalloid structure, consisting of a leafy stem and a prostrate, creeping stem that helps it anchor to the substrate. Lomariopsis pteridiformis plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat.
